project.description: The jenkins job to build the e2e tests.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: VERSION
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The version of Kubernetes to checkout and build.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
echo Starting e2e run at `date`
# If we had go installed the command to build e2e.test is: # go run hack/e2e.go -v --build # Use the docker container instead: build/run.sh make WHAT='cmd/kubectl test/e2e/e2e.test' build/run.sh make ginkgo

ARCHITECTURES="amd64 arm64 ppc64le s390x" echo "Creating resources for ${ARCHITECTURES}"
# Loop through the array of architectures to build resources. for ARCH in ${ARCHITECTURES}; do ARCH_DIR=$WORKSPACE/_output/dockerized/bin/linux/$ARCH # Can not build the resource if the architecture directory does not exist. if [ -d $ARCH_DIR ]; then cd $ARCH_DIR # Create the kubernetes-master resource. echo "Creating the ${WORKSPACE}/e2e-${VERSION}-${ARCH}.tar.gz file." E2E_BINS="e2e.test kubectl ginkgo" tar -cvzf $WORKSPACE/e2e-$VERSION-$ARCH.tar.gz $E2E_BINS
cd $WORKSPACE else echo "Missing architecture: ${ARCH}" fi done echo Resources built `date`
